title: GerminaQuant
text: application compound different tabs allow make analysis easy. Description module GerminaQuant evaluate analyze germination process.

title: GerminaQuant
text: fieldbook, can access app GerminaQuant R go “Fieldbook” tab. Fieldbook interface import data can paste Google spread sheet URL upload local file xlsx format. “Seeds (col name)” write name column containing information number seed sown experimental unit, “Evaluations (prefix)” put prefix names evaluated days germination time lapse.

title: GerminaQuant
text: parameter “Fieldbook” tab correct, “Germination” tab performed values germination indices shown maintaining experimental design. GerminaQuant allows copy downloading information “csv” “xlsx” format. Dowload option calculated variables

title: GerminaQuant
text: GerminaQuant application can perform analysis experimental design Complete Randomize Design (CRD), Randomize Complete Block Design (RCBD), Latin Square Design (LSD) factorial designs, allowing calculate analysis variance (AOV) mean differences Student Newman Keuls (SNK), Tukey Duncan test. Statitical analysis ANOVA mean comparison test

title: GerminaQuant
text: Automatically performed statistical analysis application generate graphs variable chosen mean comparison test. app interface allows customized graphics bar line plot export “tiff” format publication quality. Customized interface bar line plot

title: GerminaQuant
text: Tab allows visualize germination process according one experimental factors. app interface allows customized graphic. Germination time plot application allows plot two type graphics, first germination percentage time lapse, second relative germination calculates germination according total number germinated seeds.

title: GerminaR
text: Germination percentage mean comparision Germination experiment Prosopis juliflor different osmotic potentials temperatures. Bar graph germination percentage factorial analisys
code: ## Germination Percentage (GRP)  # analysis of variance  av <- aov(grp ~ nacl*temp + rep, data = gsm)  # mean comparison test  mc_grp <- ger_testcomp(aov = av                        , comp = c("temp", "nacl")                        , type = "snk"                        )  # data result  mc_grp$table %>%     kable(caption = "Germination percentage mean comparision") # bar graphics for germination percentage  grp <- mc_grp$table %>%     fplot(data = .        , type = "bar"        , x = "temp"        , y = "grp"        , group = "nacl"        , ylimits = c(0, 120, 30)        , ylab = "Germination ('%')"        , xlab = "Temperature"        , glab = "NaCl (MPa)"        , error = "ste"        , sig = "sig"        , color = F        )  grp

title: GerminaR
text: Mean germination time comparison Germination experiment Prosopis juliflor different osmotic potentials temperatures. Bar graph mean germination time factorial analisys. can add plot different arguments standard error, significance mean test, color, labels limits. resulted graphics performed publications allows insert math expression titles.
code: ## Mean Germination Time (MGT)  # analysis of variance  av <- aov(mgt ~ nacl*temp + rep, data = gsm)  # mean comparison test  mc_mgt <- ger_testcomp(aov = av                        , comp = c("temp", "nacl")                        , type = "snk")  # data result  mc_mgt$table %>%     kable(caption = "Mean germination time comparison") # bar graphics for mean germination time  mgt <- mc_mgt$table %>%     fplot(data = .        , type = "bar"         , x = "temp"        , y = "mgt"        , group = "nacl"        , ylimits = c(0,10, 1)        , ylab = "Mean germination time (days)"        , xlab = "Temperature"        , glab = "NaCl (MPa)"        , sig = "sig"        , error = "ste"        , color = T        )  mgt

title: GerminaR
text: cumulative analysis germination allows observe evolution germination process, able expressed percentage germination relative germination.

title: GerminaR
text: Cumulative germination nacl factor Germination experiment Prosopis juliflor different osmotic potentials temperatures. Line graph cumulative germination different osmotic potentials.
code: # data frame with percentage or relative germination in time by NaCl  git <- ger_intime(Factor = "nacl"                   , SeedN = "seeds"                   , evalName = "D"                   , method = "percentage"                   , data = fb                   )  # data result  git %>%     head(10) %>%     kable(caption = "Cumulative germination by nacl factor") # graphic germination in time by NaCl  nacl <- git %>%     fplot(data = .         , type = "line"         , x = "evaluation"         , y = "mean"         , group = "nacl"         , ylimits = c(0, 110, 10)         , ylab = "Germination ('%')"         , xlab = "Day"         , glab = "NaCl (MPa)"         , color = T         , error = "ste"         ) nacl

title: GerminaR
text: Cumulative germination temperature factor Germination experiment Prosopis juliflor different osmotic potentials temperatures. Line graph cumulative germination different temperatures.
code: # data frame with percentage or relative germination in time by temperature  git <- ger_intime(Factor = "temp"                   , SeedN = "seeds"                   , evalName = "D"                   , method = "percentage"                   , data = fb)   # data result  git %>%     head(10) %>%     kable(caption = "Cumulative germination by temperature factor") # graphic germination in time by temperature  temp <- git %>%     fplot(data = .         , type = "line"         , x = "evaluation"         , y = "mean"         , group = "temp"         , ylimits = c(0, 110, 10)         , ylab = "Germination ('%')"         , xlab = "Day"         , glab = "Temperature"         , color = F         )  temp

title: GerminaR
text: function fplot() build using ggplot2 (Wickham et al., 2020). can add arguments modify graphics adding +.
code: library(ggplot2)  git <- ger_intime(Factor = "temp"                   , SeedN = "seeds"                   , evalName = "D"                   , method = "percentage"                   , data = fb                   )   ggplot <- git %>%     fplot(data = .         , type = "line"         , x = "evaluation"         , y = "mean"         , group = "temp"         , ylimits = c(0, 110, 10)         , ylab = "Germination ('%')"         , xlab = "Day"         , glab = "Temperature"         , color = T         ) +   scale_x_continuous(n.breaks = 10, limits = c(0, 11))   ggplot

title: Introduction
text: physiology seed technology provided valuable tools production high quality seed treatments storage conditions (Marcos-Filho, 1998). basic research, seeds studied exhaustively, approach biology performed fully exploit dormancy germination (Penfield & King, 2009). important tool indicate performance seed lot precise quantification germination accurate analysis cumulative germination data (Joosen et al., 2009). Time, velocity, homogeneity, uncertainty synchrony measurements inform dynamics germination process. interesting physiologists seed technologists, also environmentalists, since possible predict degree success species, based seed crop ability redistribute germination time, allowing recruitment part seedlings formed (Ranal & Santana, 2006).

title: Introduction
text: Germination variables evaluated GerminaR package limits according Ranal Santana (2006), \(n_i\) number seeds germinated \(^{th}\) time; \(k\) last day evaluation process germination info: https://doi.org/10.1111/1440-1703.1275

title: Introduction
text: correct analysis fast data processing important take account data organization proper record germination process. section explain collect organize data.

title: Introduction
text: using GerminaR GerminaQuant necessary dataset germination values. can use following data example “prosopis”. Google account can made copy document edit online download Excel format analysis. fieldbook three essential parts.(1) factor columns (red), according experimental design;(2) seed number column, indicate number seeds sown experimental unit (green) (3) evaluation columns germination values (blue). can design field book different names column according experimental design. Layout germination evaluation process. factor column (red) according experimental design. seed number column (green) number seed sown evaluation columns (blue) accounting germination.

title: Introduction
text: evaluation germination process obtained count germination experimental unit can evaluated time lapse (hours, days, months, etc) continuous interval length always beginning time zero (ei. Ti00), end germination process according researcher criteria.

"bar" "line" x Axis x variable y Axis y variable group Group variable xlab Title axis x ylab Title axis y glab Title legend ylimits limits y axis xrotation Rotation x axis c(angle, h, v) xtext Text labels x axis gtext Text labels groups legend position legends ("none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top", two-element numeric vector) sig Column significance sigsize Font size significance letters error Show error bar ("ste" "std"). color colored figure c(TRUE, FALSE) vector color. opt Add news layer plot

title: Plot line or bar graphic — fplot
text: Line o bar plot

title: Plot line or bar graphic — fplot
code: if (FALSE) {  library(GerminaR) library(dplyr)  smr <- ger_summary(SeedN = "seeds"                    , evalName = "D"                    , data = prosopis) %>%   mutate(across(rep:temp, as.factor))    av <- aov(grp ~ nacl*temp, smr)  anova(av)  mc <- ger_testcomp(aov = av                    , comp = c("nacl", "temp"))                     plotdt <- mc$table                      plot <- fplot(data = plotdt        , type = "bar"        , x = "temp"        , y = "grp"        , group = "nacl"        , sig = "sig"        #, error = "ste"        , color = T        , ylimits = c(0, 120, 20)        )         plot         }

title: Germination Synchronization Index — ger_SYN
text: Synchory Index Z proposed assess degree overlap flowering individuals population.  adopting idea expressed PRIMACK, R.B. (1980) synchrony one seed included replication.  Z = 1 germination seeds occurs time Z = 0 least two seeds can germinate one time.  Z produces number two seeds finishing seed germination process time.  Thus, value Z assessments grade overlap seed germination.

title: Multiple comparison test — ger_testcomp
text: Function analysis variance summary data.

title: Multiple comparison test — ger_testcomp
text: aov lm o aov result function. comp treatments compared. type method made comparison analysis: c("snk", "tukey", "duncan"). sig significance level. Default 0.05

title: Multiple comparison test — ger_testcomp
text: Table complete data graphics

title: Multiple comparison test — ger_testcomp
code: if (FALSE) {  library(GerminaR) library(dplyr)  gdata <- prosopis %>% mutate(across(c(nacl, temp, rep), as.factor))  smr <- ger_summary(SeedN = "seeds", evalName = "D", data = gdata)  av <- aov(grp ~ rep + nacl*temp, smr)  mc <- ger_testcomp(aov = av                    , comp = c("nacl", "temp")                    )                     }

title: Germination Uncertainty — ger_UNC
text: uncertainty index u adaptation Shannon index measures degree uncertainty predicting informational  entropy uncertainty associated distribution relative frequency germination (GOUVEA LABOURIAU 1983; LABOURIAU; VALADARES, 1983).  Low values u indicate frequencies short peaks, .e. concentrated germination time.  Just germinated seed changes value u. means u measures degree germination scattering.

text: GOUVEA LABOURIAU, L. L. G. L. germinacao das sementes. Washington. LABOURIAU, L. G.; VALADARES, M. E. B. germination seeds. OEA, Washington, DC, 1983.

Include app info run GerminaQuant() Exclude gtools depends Include function webTable() Update ger_boxp() New domain: germinar.inkaverse.com Allow add new layer. e.g. coord_flip() Suppress error messages console run app Change dependency: ggpubr –> cowplot Exclude filter app Update tables style Module name change: Outliers -> Exploratory Exploratory Graphics Intime
